title: 820-3115 chime speaker sub not working
message:
already tried a known good speaker and i get no sound from it. no chime.

j6703 does get voltages under 1v each pin gets. but on a known good board those pins get no voltage at all

tried swapping out u6620 and u6610 no luck. machine produces sound from the small speaker but not sub

title: 820-3115 chime speaker sub not working
message:
Machine works, only missing sound from sub speaker?
PRAM reset done?
L6620/21 OK?

title: 820-3115 chime speaker sub not working
message: l6620/21 start at 2.5ohm and drop pram has been done multiple times.

title: 820-3115 chime speaker sub not working
message:
Sub and right speakers share the same connector.
You must get similar DC voltage on both.
Did you try another speaker?

title: 820-3115 chime speaker sub not working
message: Yes tried another and even tried a known good board and it gives out a chime

title: 820-3115 chime speaker sub not working
message:
Maybe U6620 is not properly soldered.
You can also change U6201...

Check traces between the two chips.
Also C6620/21 and R6622.

title: 820-3115 chime speaker sub not working
message: Switched out u6620 changed u6201 checked traces for c6620/21 and r6622 even changed out c6620/21. Still no luck but i did notice that u6880 and sorrounding resistors had water damage as well.

title: 820-3115 chime speaker sub not working
message:
U6880 is for microphone.
I suppose you still have some resistors, or small coils affected by corrosion in that area.
Various components related with tip detection can trick the audio codec.
Also corroded trace could be...
Peel out the black sponge near BIL connector and clean the board there.

title: 820-3115 chime speaker sub not working
message: Ran board through ultra sonic and replaced some suspicious resistors and retraced line but still no luck. Any other ideas?
